Job description

  • Midwifery roles available in Birthing Suite, Postnatal, Special Care

At Epworth, we care. At Epworth Freemasons, we are entrusted with bringing over 3,000 bubs safely into the world each year. With state of the art equipment and a dynamic and highly trained team, our commitment to the world’s best practice in maternity care is second to none. We also provide a range of other services related to women’s and men’s health, comprehensive cancer care, and surgical services.

Due to the demand for growth and continued community support through generous donations, the Maternity Unit at Epworth Freemasons is currently undergoing further advancements, expansions and upgrades, with state of the art facilities and best practices, in order to continue to deliver excellence in patient experience. Within a supportive and positive team nursing model, you will be an integral member of the Maternity team, and will assist in delivering exceptional patient care throughout the pregnancy journey. This is a varied role, and will be well supported by other midwives, leadership, and a multidisciplinary team.

Are you-

  • Passionate about delivering an exceptional patient experience to both our patients and their families
  • Motivated to continually learn best practice models of care
  • Committed to achieving high quality nursing care and clinical outcomes across the Birthing Suite, Postnatal or Special Care departments

Do you have-

  • Current midwifery registration with AHPRA
  • Effective operational and organisational skills
  • Comfortable working in a diverse and ever changing environment

We offer you-

  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Scholarship and leadership programs
  • Salary packaging benefits

Annual base salary range for full time (38 hours a week), prorata for part time - Registered Nurse (depending on year level) - AUD$60,279 to AUD$77,459.

Facilities Engineer

Company Name Dental Health Services Victoria Company Location 720 Swanston Street , Melbourne, VIC 3053, AU

New Posted Date Posted 5 hours ago Number of views 3 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Join a collaborative, engaged team
    • Great Carlton Location
    • Exciting organisation transformation.

    \xa0

    It’s the people who make the difference at Dental Health Services Victoria (DHSV).

    \xa0

    About the role:

    \xa0

    As part of a multi-disciplined Facilities team, the Facilities Engineer is responsible for ensuring the safe and efficient ongoing operation of buildings and assist in the day to day running of the Facilities Department. The role will liaise with departmental managers and staff to ensure repairs and works can be undertaken without affecting the clinical operations and to minimise disruption to business. The role will oversee minor projects including planning, scope development and delivery providing advice in relation to the business requirements and will also actively provide support in the delivery of larger projects.

    \xa0

    The Facilities Engineer with a hands-on approach, will act on matters pertaining to air-conditioning and mechanical services and essential plant critical to business continuity, the role will apply sound expertise to assess mechanical services and air- conditioning building infrastructure problems and resolve them. The Facilities Engineer will engage contractors and coordinate works to be completed in a timely manner and ensure works are completed to a high standard.

    \xa0

    Your responsibilities will include:

    \xa0

    • Supervise and coordinate cleaning, security and other contractors to ensure planned/contracted maintenance is delivered in line with contracts and within project budgets and ongoing compliance are met with relevant building codes, safety aspects and other legislative requirements
    • Ensure planned/contracted maintenance is delivered in line with contracts and ensure project budgets are kept on target. \xa0
    • Developing and maintaining preventative maintenance and compliance schedules

    \xa0

    To be successful in this role you will have:

    \xa0

    • Trade qualification in related field (Electrical, mechanical)
    • Understanding of building codes and other legislative requirements required for maintenance procedures
    • Experience in a supporting Engineer or Technician role with a strong focus on quality outcomes.

    \xa0

    Why you should be a part of our team?

    \xa0

    Our patients come from many different cultures and backgrounds, and treating them is what makes our job so rewarding and challenging. One thing is for certain at Dental Health Services Victoria – you will share the pride and satisfaction of putting a smile on every patient’s face. Besides a high degree of job satisfaction, Dental Health Services Victoria offers salary packaging benefits, onsite caf\xe9, convenient car parking and easy access to transport links, professional development opportunities and flexible work arrangements.

    \xa0

    About us:

    \xa0

    Dental Health Services Victoria is the leading public oral health agency in Victoria. Our aim is to improve the oral health of all Victorians, particularly vulnerable groups and those most in need. We provide Victorians with quality oral health care through the Royal Dental Hospital of Melbourne.

    \xa0

    We act with respect towards every person or idea we encounter. Together through the strength of our diversity, we create better outcomes for our patients and colleagues.

    \xa0

    We are committed to our Indigenous employment and encourage all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to apply. We are proud to be recognised in 2015 as Best in Indigenous Employment.

    We welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, workers of all ages, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ and those from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds. We acknowledge that diversity increases our ability to transform our organisation to achieve better health outcomes.

    \xa0

    We provide services through our Royal Dental Hospital of Melbourne where you will have the opportunity to work with the best oral health practitioners in Victoria. We embrace collaboration because working together helps us to create value that wouldn’t be possible through individual effort alone.

    \xa0

    Submit your application and be part of a great organisation making a huge difference in the community!


    DHSV is currently going through a period of growth and we are now looking for the best people to come and join us on this exciting journey.

    \xa0

    To submit your application, please click ‘Apply’ and follow the prompts. For further enquiries please contact careers@dhsv.org.au.

    \xa0

    Applications close: 30 October 2018.

[

Solution Architect (Stack Technologies)

Company Name Pure Storage Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 24 hours ago Number of views 13 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Us

Our ambitious goal of helping innovators build a better world with data started in 2009. Today, we are one of the fastest growing enterprise companies in history, surpassing $1B in revenue at the end of 2017.

The world is experiencing a technological revolution driven by AI, machine learning, virtual reality, quantum computing and self-driving cars -- all of which require large amounts of data and put Pure’s technology literally in the driver’s seat. Our solutions deliver real-time, secure data to power mission-critical production, DevOps, and modern analytics in multi-cloud environments. With a Satmetrix NPS score in the top 1% of B2B companies worldwide, our customer-first culture and commitment to innovation create a thriving company that employees, customers, partners, and investors love . For more information on our business, check out the corporate fact sheet .

What You Will Be Doing

This role requires a combination of skills with virtual environments, working with some of the most exciting, challenging and large-scale systems in the Asia Pacific and Japan region to drive the innovation and efficiency agenda with both existing and new customers. This includes acting as a trusted advisor to customers in use of best practices, scaling, tuning and troubleshooting of all things virtual, as well as providing guidance and feedback to Pure engineering and global product teams on future enhancements of our technology to help drive even larger gains in the technology. The second key aspect of the role is in engagement with the wider 'V' user community to build Pure’s capability and help shape the future direction of our product line witha hugely diverse user base from hedge funds to oil exploration to F1 racing teams.

This also involves traveling to conferences, expos etc to present and represent Pure where there is interest from a particular technology vertical.

More Specifics
  • Be a new Stack Technologies Subject Matter Expert (SME) for Pure Storage APJ
  • Build the Pure brand in the product vertical through a range of channels
  • Enhance the Pure technology stack to improve efficiency, performance, agility with the
  • product
  • Work closely with PM, Marketing, Engineering, CSG and global SA team to build the
  • product capability with Pure technology
  • Train internal SE community (incl. partners) to enhance their skills and knowledge with
  • the product - the ‘why Pure’ message
  • Present the Pure capability at industry vertical and product-specific events
  • Build (or enhance) social media presence to increase Pure mindshare with the product
  • user base
  • Create written collateral to build a repository of high-quality research and consumer material for Pure with the product


Role Has a Equal Split Involving
  • Customer sales meetings (must be able to articulate Pure value in a developer mindset)
  • Lab work (Build relevant demos, maintain demo environment)
  • Partner/SE enablement (Educate our SE’s and external Partners on what you know and how to translate Pure’s value to Developers and NewStack Architects))
  • Content Production/Delivery (White Papers, Speaking Engagements, Blogs, Original PPT material, Best Practices etc)


What You Bring To The Team
  • Strong consultancy/soft skills for customer engagements, 1:1 and 1:many presentations, creation of high-quality written documentation and presentation materials
  • Key Skills required: Vmware & VRealize, HyperV, OpenStack, Dockers/Containers, Kubernetes, Ansible, Redshift, AWS/Azure, DevOps CI/CD
  • Candidates from enterprise end-users with experience of managing /'owning' large virtual environments are particularly encouraged to apply
  • World-class technical skills and experience designing and implementing IT infrastructure solutions, involving virtualization and cloud technologies.
  • Technical knowledge of cloud architectures including SaaS, PaaS and IaaS
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Demonstrated experience communicating value, progress, and metrics (status) of key projects to required stakeholders and diverse audiences (technical and business)
  • Ability to work as part of a geographically dispersed team
  • Willingness to travel up to 40%
  • Must be willing and able to work in an open office, team environment.


No Storage? No Problem.

We look for talent and culture first, specific technologies second, so once you decide Pure is the right place for you, we will match you with the right project to start with. Plus, we like people to have the ability to do different things and be constantly learning, so we support our engineers in moving around to different teams and project across the company.

Pure creates opportunities for your development and career growth.

At Pure, we believe that each Puritan is a leader contributing to the success of our business, regardless of role. We offer an assortment of learning options available to all Puritans, including workshops on leadership, management, career development and more! We’re here to change the world and we hope you join us!

Popular Perks

Our rewards philosophy is tailored to provide Puritans globally competitive compensation and benefit programs that enable innovation and growth. We offer a wide variety of benefits and perks including comprehensive medical insurance, meal service, opportunities to attend events, join sports leagues, employee assistance program, work-life services, travel assistance, and employee resource groups – all of which are thoughtfully designed to maintain mind and body wellness. Through our Pure Good Foundation, we also offer numerous volunteer opportunities for employees to give back across the globe.

Pure is Committed to Equality

Pure is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other characteristic legally protected by the laws of the jurisdiction in which you are being considered for hire. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at recruitingops@purestorage.com.

Job description

\xa0

About the role

Reporting to the Senior Manager - Digital Solutions,\xa0this role will have the opportunity to be part of a high profile program of work designed to broaden and differentiate Orica’s capability for customers with new market leading digital technologies.

The Commercialisation Lead (Digital Solutions) will lead the introduction of new mining measurement, data analytics and digital technologies across Orica’s many operating markets around the world.\xa0 This will require creation of a scalable business model and go to market execution that will drive growth of these new technologies across the globe.

The Commercialisation Lead needs to have a customer first mentality, able to consider end to end requirements that will utlimately lead to a great customer experience for Orica’s new technologies.\xa0 Project management and product delivery skills will be required to lead various workstreams. \xa0In addition this role will be required to manage and co-ordinate some development partnerships with customers who have agreed to work closely with Orica in the development of new digital technologies.

What you will be doing

The Commercialisation Lead ensures that Orica’s newly developed digital solutions are operationally ready and market ready.\xa0 This includes the following responsibilities:

  • Identification and implementation of systems, processes and procedures for scalable release of new solutions to Orica’s markets across the world
  • Implementing operational, go to market and commercial requirements to accelerate revenue growth for these new solutions and services
  • Assisiting the global commercialisation of new mining measurement, analytics and digital solutions
  • Project management of various workstreams required for the overall program including
  • Risk identification and execution of mitigation strategies
  • Reporting and communicating project status to program stakeholders
  • Co-coordinating\xa03rd party technology providers or consultants
  • Provide input into overall development road-map, support models and proposition development\xa0

What you bring

  • Product development experience
  • Project management experience
  • Proven strong communications ability (written, verbal and presentation)
  • Experience in working in complex\xa0and/or matrix style organisations
  • Prior experience in mining, mining services, product development or digital systems background would be well regarded.

Desired Skills and Experience

What we offer

  • The opportunities, facilities and environment associated with working in an international organisation;
  • Career paths that are totally flexible allowing you to specialise or become a generalist;
  • A\xa0diverse workplace where your unique abilities and talents will be recognised and encouraged;
  • Training programs, opportunities and initiatives to ensure your continued growth;
  • Competitive salary packages.

Customer Experience and Resolution Manager

Company Name Think Talent Pty Ltd Company Location Frankston, Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 23 minutes ago Number of views 6 views

Job description


The Opportunity




The Customer Experience & Resolution Manager provides critical insights to guide the customer strategy and day to day service delivery excellence. The role will consult and influence strongly across the business to ensure a whole-of-business approach to improving customer experience for customers.




The role reports directly to the General Manager, Customer and Community Engagement and is accountable for:



  • Acting as a key customer advocate, ensuring the identification of pain points and opportunities to improve customer experience across all channels and touchpoints (through extensive business area and customer engagement, research and metrics), providing actionable insights for operational teams to address.
  • Managing customer experience measurement and reporting platform(s) and leading the review of customer experience KPIs and adoption within the broader sector and regulatory frameworks.
  • Benchmarking customer experience KPIs more broadly, outside the sector, and keeping abreast of global consumer trends and research;
  • Working collaboratively across the organisation to enhance customer service performance and ensure the customer voice is front and centre in all decisions.
  • Journey mapping customer experiences to determine future customer experience state maps strategy development and delivery of long term business efficiencies.
  • Delivering presentations to the Executive and Board as required
  • Developing and leading a high performance and engaged team of customer focussed professionals and working collaboratively with the Service Design & Research Manager and the Channel Strategy manager.




To Be Successful



  • Relevant marketing, communications or other relevant business qualifications. Post graduate degree is highly regarded.
  • Demonstrated experience in managing customer insights, experience and service improvement outcomes across various industries.
  • Broad understanding of economic regulatory frameworks and customer engagement linkages.
  • Demonstrated experience in influencing change and working collaboratively across organisations to improve customer experiences.
  • Strong understanding and demonstrated experience in sophisticated customer data analysis, surveying and research techniques.
  • Digital experience measurement techniques and testing i.e. wireframe testing, journey mapping highly regarded.
  • Strong strategic thinking and planning experience including the development of customer experience strategies.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead a team to deliver on time and on budget.






What's in it for you?

  • State of the art, modern-industrial style office that facilitates new ways of working and collaborating
  • Beautiful Bayside location
  • Join a cross-functional team that connects customer feedback and insights with service design and digital innovation
  • Engaged culture, purpose driven and a collaborative working style that exists at all levels
  • Strong leadership, offering development opportunities
  • Opportunity to contribute towards a sustainability agenda that brings performance and the environment together






Interested? For prompt consideration "apply now" or for a confidential discussion, please contact Chloe Sharpin at Think Talent on 0408 276 170.

[

Data Architect

Company Name BlueScope Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago Number of views 13 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Who are we?
BlueScope is a technically advanced supplier of premium, branded coated and painted steel products - the third largest manufacturer of painted and coated steel products globally. Every day we showcase our innovation, technology and expertise right throughout the world.

What is the role?
We are looking for a Data Architect\xa0to join our IT team in a newly created position, based in Wollongong\xa0or Mount Waverley. Seize the opportunity to apply your knowledge and enhance our business insights through data!

Reporting to the Data Platform Owner for our Australian Steel Products (ASP) business, this position will provide recommendations for technological adoption to better define, consolidate and generate insights from data. This will see you:


  • support the business to access fit-for-purpose data within their domains;
  • interact with various technical and business stakeholders to define architectures and options;
  • translate architectures and options for various stakeholders through project concept, feasibility and design;
  • develop data options that support architecture objectives;
  • help define and maintain architecture reference models; and
  • improve analytical capability across IT and ASP.


Who are we looking for?
Along with a relevant tertiary qualification, you will possess the following attributes:


  • experience in gathering business requirements, understanding strategic goals and then defining suitable data architectures;
  • skills in developing logical and physical designs of data repositories;
  • background in big data technologies (e.g. Cloudera) to implement data mining, wrangling and modelling solutions; and
  • a passion for sharing your knowledge, enthusiasm for ongoing professional development and the ability to present to senior management.


What are the benefits?
You will have scope to do exciting work where your contribution will be highly visible and recognised. Flexible working requirements will be discussed on a per-candidates basis. The successful candidate will receive:


  • salaried remuneration with attractive superannuation options;
  • the opportunity to participate in the performance incentive scheme; and
  • access to further development and career opportunities with BlueScope.


We believe that our people are our strength. Having a diverse and inclusive workplace enables us to improve our capability and ensure continued, sustainable success.

Information Librarian

Company Name City of Greater Dandenong Company Location Dandenong, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 18 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Band 5, $67,177 - $77,829 pa pro rata

Temporary part time (28hrs per week for 12 months)

The City of Greater Dandenong is an organisation of exceptional character. We invest in the development of our people and the community and we strive to be a workplace that is respectful, engaged, accountable, creative and honest. We are a progressive organisation, in a city that is on the move and we offer a dynamic and rewarding work environment.

We offer exceptional working conditions and are focused on providing a workplace that values diverse contributions, cares for your health and wellbeing and fosters a positive work culture. We ensure all people have an equal opportunity for employment and advancement within our organisation.

We embrace our diverse community and work environment and encourage applications from everyone including people of Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander background, people of diverse sexual orientation and gender, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, and people of varied age, ability, and faith. Council will give due consideration to any workplace adjustments to accommodate the needs of any prospective or existing staff member.

The part time Information Librarian works within the Community Arts, Culture and Library Services Department, and at both Library sites, Springvale and Dandenong.

The Primary Objectives Of The Position Are To
  • Provide effective and efficient library and information services to all Library users.
  • Supervise staff and efficient operation of front-of-house Library Services as rostered Librarian, providing a responsive and flexible service.
  • Support and delivery of high quality library programs that support learning, literacy and social inclusion.
  • Contributes to the development of content to the Libraries’ web presence. (Virtual Library)

The successful applicant will possess a degree or postgraduate diploma in librarianship/information & knowledge management with eligibility for professional membership to the Australian Library and Information Association. Proven experience in delivery of library services, and a passion for promoting literacy and working in a culturally and linguistically diverse and busy environment will be highly regarded. The ideal candidate has the ability to work in a diverse and busy library environment. An understanding and demonstrated experience of current technologies and willingness to embrace and explore emerging technologies relevant to libraries is essential. Regular evening and weekend shifts are compulsory.

Applicants must adequately meet the requirements of the role and fully address the selection criteria contained in the position description. To view a copy of this position description, please click on the link below.

Information Librarian - April 2015.pdf

You will be required to undertake a functional capacity assessment (physical).

The preferred candidate will be asked to produce a clear Working with Children Check.

We offer a range of benefits for staff including a friendly team environment, salary sacrificed child care (where available), discounted gym membership and a vibrant social club.

Further information: Karmel Savahl 8571 1717
Applications close: 5pm, Friday, 26 October 2018

[

Principal Project Officer, Change Management

Company Name Department of Health & Human Services, Victoria Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 3 hours ago Number of views 5 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Description

The Department of Health and Human Services develops and delivers policies, programs and services that support and enhance the wellbeing of all Victorians. Our services are in line with the government's vision for making Victoria a stronger, more caring and innovative state. Our vision is to achieve the best health, wellbeing and safety of all Victorians so that they can live a life they value. We are building an inclusive workplace that embraces diversity of backgrounds and differences to realise the potential of our employees for innovation and delivering services aimed at enhancing the lives of vulnerable Victorians. The department is committed to the safety of its clients. The department takes a zero tolerance approach to abuse, including child abuse and abuse of people with disability. Departmental employees are required to comply with all legal requirements including the Child Safe Standards to keep children safe from harm and abuse. All jobs can be worked flexibly and we encourage job applications from Aboriginal people, people with disabilities, LGBTI and people from culturally diverse backgrounds. If you want a career within a department striving to make Victoria the best place to be and helping shape communities we all want to be part of, then we encourage you to apply. If you are an Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander applicant, or if you have a disability, and require advice and support with the recruitment process, contact our Diversity Unit on DiversityInclusion@dhhs.vic.gov.au. The department has a zero tolerance towards violence within the workplace and recognises the rights of all staff to be free from violence and gender-related discrimination. We are proudly working with White Ribbon to create a safer workplace.

Number of vacancies available: 1

Position Summary

The Principal Project Officer, Change Management is responsible for the delivery and development of an effective change management and communications strategy to support the implementation of a new Service Management Platform. This position will work closely with communications and change management teams to ensure a coordinated and engaging approach to change and adoption is deployed.

The Service Management Platform is a new ICT system that will seek to introduce new capabilities, which includes, Case Management, Ticketing and Self Services, Workforce Management and Telephony.

Are You
  • Committed to driving successful and productive change initiatives?
  • A strategic thinker with a demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with stakeholders to develop and implement projects/initiatives?
  • Able to maintain collaborative relationships with key stakeholders?


How To Apply

Applicants are encouraged to apply online, submitting a cover letter and a current resume.

Please Note

For this role, you are not required to address each of the key selection criteria in a separate written document. Applicants are strongly encouraged to review our Careers Page . This page provides information on the department's recruitment and safety screening processes.

Click 'Apply Now' below to submit your interest in this role.

For further information please visit the Department of Health and Human Services website: https://www.dhhs.vic.gov.au/

Applicants must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or hold a valid work permit or visa. Work eligibility will be checked as part of the recruitment process.
